paper_metadata.title: Phenotypic features and genetic characterization of male breast cancer families: identification of two recurrent BRCA2 mutations in north-east of Italy
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on two pathogenic BRCA2 mutations, including penetrance data and individual records of affected and unaffected carriers.

patients.demographics: Mean age at diagnosis 54.5 years; 3/10 patients younger than 50 years.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The carriers of the 9106C>T mutation showed a median age of breast cancer onset of 49 years.
The carriers of the 9106C>T mutation showed a median age of breast cancer onset of 49 years.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a premature protein truncation.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on familial segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is recurrent in MBC cases from North-East Italy.
key_quotes: The 9106C>T and the IVS16-2A>G mutations constitute recurrent BRCA2 mutations in MBC cases from the North-East of Italy.

patients.demographics: Mean age at diagnosis 54.5 years; 3/10 patients younger than 50 years.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In one IVS16-2A>G positive family, a first-degree relative (the father of the BR195 proband) was affected by a MBC diagnosed at 38 years.
The carriers of the IVS16-2A>G mutation showed a median age of breast cancer onset of 60 years.

functional_data.summary: The mutation leads to a partial or total skipping of exon 17.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on familial segregation and clinical presentation.
variants.additional_notes: This mutation is recurrent in MBC cases from North-East Italy.
key_quotes: The 9106C>T and the IVS16-2A>G mutations constitute recurrent BRCA2 mutations in MBC cases from the North-East of Italy.

tables_processed.table_caption: Summary of BRCA2 mutations and associated clinical data.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
